website_summaries.verdict: Outstanding image quality from the Mark III's strong image sensor. Sells for a reasonable price as compared to other mirrorless cameras.
pros: Image stabilization allows you to record smooth, sharp video and photographs, reducing camera shake
Compact design is desirable for transport
Strong burst mode performance at more than 8 fps
cons: Could use more improvements over the Mark II

customer_reviews.title: Best travel camera!
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the best cameras I've had for traveling. Small body with bunch of features and great image quality. Olympus app makes it fast and easy to transfer pictures to your phone so you can share on social media.
customer_reviews.author: Rodrigo Santos Legaspi

customer_reviews.title: New M4/3 User
customer_reviews.text: I moved from the Sony A6000 to the M10, and love the camera. My primary reason for switching was the high cost of the e-mount lenses in comparison to the M4/3 format. As another review noted, if you own the Mark II version, this may not be a compelling upgrade. However, if you are new to Olympus, this is a great camera. Though it’s a 16MP sensor vs. the Sony’s 20, in practical use, there’s no discernible difference in image quality.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Norris

customer_reviews.title: Very nice introductory camera
customer_reviews.text: I know nothing about photography and wanted an introductory camera. I do like this camera, but feel like i need some guidance on how to use it for everything that it’s worth. It takes beautiful photos and has built in filters. It also connects wirelessly to my phone so i can immediately transfer photos straight to my mobile. I LOVE that feature. Did i mention how cute the camera itself is? It’s gorgeous!
customer_reviews.author: Candita

customer_reviews.title: I love this camera!
customer_reviews.text: I'm having a great time with this camera. The kit lens it comes with is more versatile than I had thought it would be, and I was able to buy the longer zoom kit lens for a pretty low price, to complement it. The camera bag is a great size for toting around and easily accommodates the camera body and an extra lens. I find the camera to be pretty easy to use, too, in its various shooting modes.
customer_reviews.author: Michael J. Descy

customer_reviews.title: Skin tones too warm
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this camera to take photos and videos of my kids. I was enticed by the image stabilization. The camera took great photos outside. Inside photos were also good. It worked well for food, pets, everything except....my fair skinned children. Skin tones were way red. Adjusting white balance and using manual helped, but even adjusting all the way the skin tones in photos were warmer than natural. Someone with more time and skill might be able to remedy this. As a mom who just wanted to snap some decent candids, it was a deal breaker. I returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Carl W. Koch

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful new tool (toy)
customer_reviews.text: Straight out of the box I had anxiety because of the size and weight of the camera. So small and light, it didn’t feel like a real camera. Then I started to play around with pictures and settings, pulling out all sorts of items to photograph. It will take time for an amateur like myself to learn and outgrow this wonderful new tool. I will say unboxing was simple, fun, and quick, which had me taking pictures in less than 2 minutes from picking it up off my doorstep. I look forward to many more amazing pictures and learning how to maximize the cameras use.
customer_reviews.author: timmahb

customer_reviews.title: Excellent camera
customer_reviews.text: I got this for travel and human interest photography, often quick shots in less than ideal conditions. I appreciate the stabilization and ease of use. Dpreview.com, comsumers and others have extended reviews of the camera capability. I did gave the camera a 5-star rating with some reluctance. I would prefer to reserve 5 for truly "ideal" products. There are probably not many of those, but this comes pretty close. For example, I would like a bigger sensor with more resolution that would improve the chances of getting sharp photos taken in low light on the fly. If Olympus did that, with the same current features, I would upgrade in an instant.
customer_reviews.author: ComputersRMe

customer_reviews.title: Small and Powerful
customer_reviews.text: Ok I just got this today and took some sample photos. It is a very small camera. Which I like but it is a little more difficult to use due to that. However it is light and will fit in my coat pocket and takes great photos so far. I will update thus review as I get used to it. For the size of the camera the veiwfinder is great. Very satisfied with it. I have a sony A6300, Sony A7iii. So I am used to really good viewfinder. This one is of course smaller but dis not disappoint. I think I am going to have fun with this for bird photography.
customer_reviews.author: Julian Caesar

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Camera
customer_reviews.text: I love this camera. For an amateur it's perfect. I wish I would have just purchased the body only because I ended up buying a better lens and I never use the one that came with the lens kit. But still I'm very happy with my purchase. I had still been using my Olympus Pen PL- 2 I purchased in 2012 but it got stolen in October during a trip to California. So I kinda rushed and bought this guy after seeing a lot of positive reviews. The only thing I recommend is buying the body and lens separately instead of the body and lens kit.
customer_reviews.author: D avid Sh iver

customer_reviews.title: An Impressive Camera
customer_reviews.text: My father got me into photography in the 70's and helped me choose a wonderful Olympus OM-1 that is now an antique. I wanted to get back to taking photos again, not happy with the limitations of cell phones. Immediately, Olympus came to mind and this camera is perfect. It's solidly made and will allow me to add on accessories as I become more adept at handling it. It has, in a way, the weighty & familiar feel of my OM-1. The quality is great and positioning of dials is easy to learn. I'd recommend this camera to any beginner who wants a camera that will help them develop their photo skills.
customer_reviews.author: Mary T

customer_reviews.title: Great Starter Camera
customer_reviews.text: I love this camera. I got to make movies, take many photos and upload everything to my phone with the software that comes. I have 0 need to purchase another camera. I will get a few more lenses to go with this little beautiful toy.
customer_reviews.author: greenwolf

customer_reviews.title: Lens stopped working after a couple of months.
customer_reviews.text: Initially, I really enjoyed using this camera but after only 2.5 months of use, the lens is completely useless. It won't extend when the camera is switched on and I am unable to take any photos with it. I am super disappointed about this and after looking around online I have read that it is a fairly common fault with the lens. My return window with Amazon closed about a week before the lens died so I am stuck with a camera that I can't use until I spend a couple hundred more dollars on a new lens. NOT IMPRESSED!
customer_reviews.author: Libby Grace

customer_reviews.title: Great camera during its short life (5 days)
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera for my trip to India (I received it 3 days before to leave). I love the look, it's light and really user-friendly and as a beginner, I was satisfied by the quality of the pictures and videos I took. BUT after a few days, the screen started to freeze for no reason while I was taking pictures and the only way to unfreeze it was to remove the battery. After one day like this, the camera would not turn on at all. I was very disappointed by its quality and I ended up travelling with my dead camera.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica L.

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous Small Camera
customer_reviews.text: I went from DSLR to a compact Lumix ZS40 because the DSLR was too bulky for my travel needs. The Olympus is quite small and takes amazing photos. It hits that Goldilocks "size vs. capabilities" spot for me, though I still use the Lumix when space and weight are tight. I experimented to find the situations where overriding the auto settings would improve the quality of the photos. . . I haven't found one, yet.
customer_reviews.author: J. Cotton

customer_reviews.title: Just a mediocre camera
customer_reviews.text: This camera is nothing short of a mediocre gear. I had to compare it with the Canon EOS 700D, the camera I previously owned. This Olympus camera is the first mistake I made in the direction of switching to a mirror less camera. 1. If you are an auto-click maniac you probably will love this. But the moment you need manual focus you would start hating this one. 2. The co tells are not intuitive and are not accurate while in action.
customer_reviews.author: Roshan Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Good Camera
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded from a Panasonic LUMIX GF3 and was able to use all my Lumix lenses. The camera is very easy to use and produce excellent pictures.
customer_reviews.author: Glen

customer_reviews.title: Very impressive camera. Get the 40-150mm lens.
customer_reviews.text: Replaced my Nikon d3000 with this. Highly recommend the 50-150mm lens. Build quality is impressive and photographs look great when taken in RAW.
customer_reviews.author: Jake

customer_reviews.title: Awesome enthusiast camera
customer_reviews.text: I love this Olympus EM10 Mark III. It has great high quality feel, works well, takes great pictures, has a lot of features for the price, and the included lens is versatile and high quality. This is not a professional grade camera, but that doesn’t mean you couldn’t use it professionally if you only need one memory card slot and familiarize yourself with its buttons and functions.
customer_reviews.author: Jared Clark

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic collection of features
customer_reviews.text: This is a gem. More features than I will ever use, but available to me if I should choose. I never thought that I would live to see an SLR as small and feature-packed in this price range.
customer_reviews.author: Leonard Crouch

customer_reviews.title: Average camera.
customer_reviews.text: Look nice. But it's just an average camera. Not as good as my old Nikon D5500 in picture quality. Only 16 mega pixels.
customer_reviews.author: SN2000

customer_reviews.title: Not impressed
customer_reviews.text: Am I the only one that isn’t impressed with the photos taken from this camera??? My daughter looks orange in all the photos and the photos are blurry. My iPhone takes better pictures. Maybe I need some assistance but right now I’m shooting on auto and the photos are impressive.
customer_reviews.author: Stobaugh

customer_reviews.title: First Mirrorless Camera
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been using this camera along with my 2013 Nikon D7100 for video and I must say that I’m very impressed at how far the technology has come from the time the 2 were released. The Olympus camera is very easy to use and so much lighter in weight. I’m am pleased with my purchase and highly recommend this camera to anyone on a budget that needs good quality.
customer_reviews.author: Morgan

customer_reviews.title: Perfect amateur
customer_reviews.text: This camera is absolutely amazing. It has so many cool features available. It’s a good first camera for amateurs. I got it for my wife so she could take photos because she loves photography. She took some really beautiful ones of the moon and our daughter. The quality is just unbeatable and unmatchable. I did however get 150 mm lens out on because if you want really good pictures from far away especially of the moon having another attachable piece take for their away pictures is better
customer_reviews.author: Cameron

customer_reviews.title: Complete amateur here
customer_reviews.text: I love the look of this camera, that old vintage look, but with present day features. I'm a complete amateur at photography, my previous cameras being digital point and shoot. This camera allows you to do just that as well, point and shoot. It has other photograph modes as well, so someone who actually practices photography could get more out of this camera than I can. Overall, I love the look, and how simple it is to use with the basic auto mode.
customer_reviews.author: Armando Saldana Cruz

customer_reviews.title: My fav camera
customer_reviews.text: I love the picture taking quality. I like having more control. The size and weight of the camera is great -- not too heavy.
customer_reviews.author: David K.

customer_reviews.title: Not well designed ergonomically
customer_reviews.text: personnaly I found this camera did not feel comfortable in my hand. It lacked the ergonomic feel of several other cameras available in the market for less money. It’s almost too small. I strongly recommend you visit a camera store and handle it before buying. I returned it for full credit.
customer_reviews.author: W. Lamb

customer_reviews.title: Satisfied
customer_reviews.text: My first camera. I love the design I love how easy and intuitive it is. Slowly learning. And can’t wait to get to the point I’ll know everything about it.
customer_reviews.author: Julia R.

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Easy to carry, and use the wifi send photos to your phone,so I can take a lot of photos for the baby as a memorial, the photo taken is particularly good texture, do not need too much decoration I really like this creame
customer_reviews.author: xuxiaojun

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: Amazing camera, I would say it's a semi professional. Perfect for star trails and time lapse. It also has a feature called Art Photography with different effects.
customer_reviews.author: Giacomo

customer_reviews.title: Olympus rocks
customer_reviews.text: I’ve owned many digital and film cameras. This Olympus is awesome. Worth twice the price. Compact and full featured. Great glass, image stabilization, features etc. Very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: D. Podeschi

customer_reviews.title: Very good camera over all
customer_reviews.text: Im very pleased with this purchase very good camera over all especially for this range of price ,very good image quality, awesome image stabilisation, awesome bulid quality, very nice looking camera.
customer_reviews.author: Rebaz

customer_reviews.title: Happy with camera.
customer_reviews.text: I am not a photography enthusiast. Use on auto mode. Takes good pictures. Needed a camera that was not too bulky and that could eccept a macro lens for photographing insects. Difficult to do with my cell phone camera.
customer_reviews.author: Hystyle

customer_reviews.title: Camera works, but clearly a used item
customer_reviews.text: The outer package upon arrival is very dirty, some part of it is torn, and there are two layers of duck tape at the opening, clearly this one is opened before. The inner package is also kind of dirty. All the components inside are not sealed, so I am not sure if it is a used one.
customer_reviews.author: Andy

customer_reviews.title: nice
customer_reviews.text: Very good camera, but it is still a little worse for me. Maybe I am used to the nikon full-frame camera. The contrast between the photos is not as good as the ideal, but the tour is very suitable.
customer_reviews.author: vincent liang

customer_reviews.title: Camera worked well, package was opened.
customer_reviews.text: The camera itself was fine but I clearly got a used product because the box was already opened, camera already assembled, the memory card was missing and the string to the lense cap was broken. I returned it and rdered the camera from another website.
customer_reviews.author: Cris

customer_reviews.title: Worth for the price
customer_reviews.text: The camera is well build and the image stabilisation is really good. Only downside is it sometimes struggle on autofocus.
customer_reviews.author: Vineeth Kurup

customer_reviews.title: Great camera for the price
customer_reviews.text: This company is great I received my camera at the expected time. The camera itself is excellent quality for images. I was super impressed right out of the box. Though I’m still learning the camera I think it will work great for many years!
customer_reviews.author: Courtney

customer_reviews.title: This is best mirrorless camera
customer_reviews.text: This is best mirrorless camera. i shifted from Canon T5i to this one. Great features. Works great under low light.
customer_reviews.author: Megha Devliyal

customer_reviews.title: Good camera to learn and grow yourself into photography
customer_reviews.text: Nice build quality, excellent image stabilization, good color science and superb looks
customer_reviews.author: satwant kumar

customer_reviews.title: Good buy
customer_reviews.text: Great camera! Easy to use, lots of features and looks very stylish.
customer_reviews.author: CeCe

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, reliable
customer_reviews.text: Easy way to transfer pictures from the Camera to the phone, intuitive software and interface. Customer service was very reliable and helpful. Overall great acquisition!
customer_reviews.author: Marcelo Kenzo Naya Takahashi

customer_reviews.title: Over all good camera
customer_reviews.text: This was my first time playing with micro 4/3, it was a lot of fun and very light weight. Definitely not my style but a great camera i prefer my big canon DSLR.
customer_reviews.author: Carter Klute

customer_reviews.title: Great Update
customer_reviews.text: Great update of the original OM-D E-M10. It adds 4K video and an easier menu system and takes great pictures like its previous models. I'm not sure that anyone owning the OM-D E-M10II would benefit much to upgrade to this model, unless they want the 4K video. I own the original E-M10 and I am really enjoying some of the newer features. It is easy to use for beginners and a good way to get started in more advanced photography.I think more advance photographer would also like the camera. I love the size and weight of the Olympus micro four third cameras. They are great for travel with very little compromise in picture quality when compared with larger sensor cameras.
customer_reviews.author: E. Mencer

customer_reviews.title: Great camera
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a first camera for my husband. He loved it. Very easy to use and great pictures. Delivery was very fast
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Smith

customer_reviews.title: Great camera
customer_reviews.text: I love this camera, it is light, easy to use and the picture quality is just what I expected.
customer_reviews.author: Sandy

customer_reviews.title: The perfect camera for beginners.
customer_reviews.text: An easy user interface, great quality for a regular non-professional user. Also, the classic look is a plus if you are into aesthetics.
customer_reviews.author: Cliente Amazon

customer_reviews.title: Great camera
customer_reviews.text: Love this camera! It’s our 3rd Olympus. Seller was great to work with too!
customer_reviews.author: Linda Illingworth

customer_reviews.title: Received it fine, and got to test shoot with it for ...
customer_reviews.text: It's not deserving of a 5 star ratinf, but neither is it of a 3. I purchased this as a less built travel option to my dslr. Received it fine, and got to test shoot with it for a day or two. I highly advise you rethink about a self retracting kit lens before purchasing this. The shots it took were great. The body is lightweight. The features are nice. However, on only my second instance using the camera the auto retracting kit lens jammed upon trying to enter sleep mode, a huge bummer. Had to return it for that reason. Exploring other options for a mirrorless camera for now.
customer_reviews.author: A. Bell

customer_reviews.title: Wife loves this camera
customer_reviews.text: Camera is easy to use. Bought it for my wife and she loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Tewell

customer_reviews.title: Olympus has made using this camera very easy. A tip though
customer_reviews.text: I am relatively new to the Digital camera world. However, Olympus has made using this camera very easy. A tip though, download the manual PDF from the interwebs as the included manual doesn’t really go over anything. Also, acquire the 50-150 lens, I use that lens about 50/50 compared to the included 14-40
customer_reviews.author: Josh J.

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely mind-blowing.
customer_reviews.text: Upgraded from a 6 year old Canon S-100. So for me this was first time using a mirrorless camera. But the picture quality even on the automatic settings is perfect. Will update the review after a few weeks of playing with manual modes as well. Slightly bulky ...but that is expected. Very well built. Love the classic look
customer_reviews.author: Uppal

customer_reviews.title: Occasionally you find something that is better than you imagined.
customer_reviews.text: Very cool little camera. I'm excited to adapt some legacy 35mm lenses to this guy. Using manual mode focus peaking it looks like you can take very good photos using old glass.
customer_reviews.author: Swiftboat

customer_reviews.title: The product is perfect but only has one BIG problem
customer_reviews.text: The product is perfect but only has one BIG problem, the Olympus App to share pictures with the phone is not available for LatinAmerica. I tried to talk with Olympus but nothing...
customer_reviews.author: Rodrigo Álvarez

customer_reviews.title: They do a great job of making some of the most advanced features ...
customer_reviews.text: Pleasant camera. Simplified down quite a bit from the mark ii, but that's the type of user this camera is targeted at. They do a great job of making some of the most advanced features more accessible in this version (the last one was a little more opaque). Fits comfortably in the hand and pairs well with the Panasonic 25mm lens.
customer_reviews.author: Brennan S

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as the Panasonic bodies (due to their implementation of ...
customer_reviews.text: Got this camera mainly for travel. It's definitely a downgrade from the mark ii version of the camera but I wanted 4k video. The additional focusing points is an added bonus. Not as good as the Panasonic bodies (due to their implementation of DFD).
customer_reviews.author: Robert R.

customer_reviews.title: Disappointment, at least the design is nice
customer_reviews.text: Automatic mode is pretty bad, so it’s hard to just snap an image quickly. HDR is pretty bad too and the lCD monitor is low quality. Customer service is really bad and no global warrenty, too bad they don’t put it in bold as I live outside the US. I should have gone for the Sony, save your headache.
customer_reviews.author: Eilon yahalome

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, great quality
customer_reviews.text: I do love having my camera! Great pictures and lots of new thing to learn to make your pictures creative!
customer_reviews.author: Naj. a

customer_reviews.title: Smile
customer_reviews.text: Great camera and the picture quality is awesome! Very easy to use and the camera itself has an epic retro look to it. Fast and quick shipping and an wonderful product. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: L. L. Taylor II

product_meta.title: Olympus OM-D E-M10 Mark III Camera Body (Black), Wi-Fi Enabled, 4K Video
product_meta.description: The Olympus E-M10 mark III has been specially designed for people who love photography and need the perfect system to get started. The E-M10 mark III is small and lightweight so it’s convenient to take everywhere. The new intuitive touch screen interface and shortcut button make camera settings easy. Touch AF lets you instantly focus and trip the shutter with one touch of your subject on the tilting screen. And with foolproof in-body image stabilization, you'll easily shoot blur-free stills and smooth 4K video, all handheld, no tripod or other stabilizing gear needed. Start your photographic journey with the E-M10 mark III.
feature_bullets: In body 5 axis image stabilization for blur free stills and smooth 4K video
16 megapixel live MOS sensor and TruePic VIII image processor
4K 30P video plus HD 120 frames per second high speed video
Timeless, easy to use body design; Compact & lightweight with 2 dials, arrow pad and shortcut button
3.0 inches tilting LCD monitor with intuitive touch screen operation and touch AF 1 step shutter release

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars20 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
